data.title: Criminal Psychology Research
data.text: Exploring the causes, characteristics and intervention strategies of criminal psychology to assist in crime prevention and rehabilitation.

data.title: Overview of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter will introduce the definition, history, basic theories and research fields of criminal psychology.

items.title: Definition of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is the study of criminal behavior and its psychological mechanisms, aiming to understand the psychological characteristics and behavioral motivations of criminals.

items.title: History of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology originated in the late 19th century and gradually formed an independent discipline with the development of psychology and law.

items.title: Main Research Fields
items.text: Includes causes of criminal psychology, crime type analysis, criminal psychological assessment and intervention.

items.title: Relationship with Other Disciplines
items.text: Criminal psychology is closely related to law, sociology, biology and other disciplines in exploring criminal phenomena.

items.title: Biological Theory
items.text: Explores the influence of genetic and neurophysiological factors on criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Theory
items.text: Analyzes the relationship between personality, cognition, emotion and criminal behavior.

items.title: Sociological Theory
items.text: Studies the shaping effect of social environment and cultural background on criminal psychology.

items.title: Integrated Theory
items.text: Combines biological, psychological and sociological perspectives to comprehensively explain criminal psychology.

data.title: Formation of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter will explore the influence of individual factors, environmental factors and psychological processes on criminal psychology.

items.title: Genetic Factors
items.text: Research on potential links between genes and criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Traits
items.text: Exploration of personality traits such as aggression and impulsivity in relation to crime.

items.title: Personality Disorders
items.text: Analysis of psychological disorders like antisocial personality disorder and their role in criminal behavior.

items.title: Early Experiences
items.text: Research on the long-term effects of childhood trauma and domestic violence on criminal psychology.

items.title: Family Environment
items.text: Exploration of how family structure and education methods shape criminal psychology.

items.title: Social Environment
items.text: Analysis of peer pressure and community environment in inducing criminal behavior.

items.title: Economic Factors
items.text: Research on the relationship between poverty, unemployment and crime rates.

items.title: Cultural Background
items.text: Exploration of how cultural values influence criminal psychology.

items.title: Cognitive Processes
items.text: Analysis of criminals' thinking patterns and decision-making processes.

items.title: Emotional Processes
items.text: Exploration of emotional regulation and emotional deficits in relation to criminal behavior.

items.title: Behavioral Motivation
items.text: Research on criminals' internal motivations such as profit-driven or revenge psychology.

items.title: Decision-Making Mechanisms
items.text: Analysis of criminals' decision-making processes and psychological mechanisms before committing crimes.

data.title: Crime Types and Psychological Characteristics
data.text: This chapter will analyze the psychological characteristics of violent crimes, property crimes and cyber crimes.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Murder
items.text: Exploration of murderers' psychological motivations such as emotional conflicts and interest disputes.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Robbery
items.text: Analysis of robbers' risk-taking psychology and dependence on violence.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Sexual Crimes
items.text: Research on sexual offenders' psychological distortions and behavioral patterns.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Domestic Violence
items.text: Exploration of domestic violence perpetrators' desire for control and emotional deficiencies.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Theft
items.text: Analysis of thieves' opportunistic psychology and material desires.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Fraud
items.text: Exploration of fraudsters' deception techniques and psychological manipulation abilities.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Corruption
items.text: Research on corrupt individuals' desire for power and moral degradation.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Money Laundering
items.text: Analysis of money launderers' risk-averse psychology and legal avoidance strategies.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Hackers
items.text: Exploration of hackers' technical worship and challenge to authority.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Cyber Fraud
items.text: Analysis of cyber fraudsters' disguise abilities and psychological manipulation techniques.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Cyber Violence
items.text: Research on cyber violence perpetrators' anonymous psychology and aggressiveness.

items.title: Internet Addiction and Crime
items.text: Exploration of internet addicts' dependence on virtual worlds and its connection to criminal behavior.

data.title: Criminal Psychological Assessment and Intervention
data.text: This chapter will introduce criminal psychological assessment methods and intervention strategies, exploring prevention measures.

items.title: Psychological Testing
items.text: Assessing criminals' psychological state and personality characteristics through standardized tests.

items.title: Behavioral Observation
items.text: Observing criminals' daily behaviors to analyze their behavioral patterns and psychological motivations.

items.title: Interview Techniques
items.text: Understanding criminals' psychological processes and motivations through in-depth interviews.

items.title: Case Analysis
items.text: Analyzing criminals' psychological characteristics and behavioral patterns through typical cases.

items.title: Psychological Treatment
items.text: Helping criminals correct psychological problems through psychological counseling and therapy.

items.title: Behavioral Correction
items.text: Helping criminals change bad behavior patterns through behavioral training.

items.title: Social Support
items.text: Providing social resources to help criminals reintegrate into society.

items.title: Legal Intervention
items.text: Restraining and punishing criminal behavior through legal means.

items.title: Early Intervention
items.text: Preventing potential criminals' behavioral problems through early psychological intervention.

items.title: Educational Prevention
items.text: Improving public legal awareness and mental health levels through education.

items.title: Community Prevention
items.text: Enhancing social cohesion and reducing crime incentives through community activities.

items.title: Policy Prevention
items.text: Reducing social inequality and lowering crime rates through policy making.

data.title: Applications of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter will explore the applications of criminal psychology in criminal justice, crime prevention, research and education.

items.title: Criminal Profiling
items.text: Depicting criminals' characteristics through psychological analysis to assist in case solving.

items.title: Interrogation Techniques
items.text: Improving interrogation efficiency and obtaining truthful confessions using psychological methods.

items.title: Witness Psychology
items.text: Studying witnesses' psychological states and their impact on testimony credibility.

items.title: Jury Decision-Making
items.text: Analyzing jurors' psychological processes and their impact on verdicts.

items.title: Crime Prevention Strategies
items.text: Preventing criminal behavior through psychological intervention and social support.

items.title: Prison Psychological Rehabilitation
items.text: Helping inmates correct psychological problems through psychological treatment to reduce recidivism.

items.title: Community Correction
items.text: Helping criminals reintegrate into society through community support to reduce recidivism risk.

items.title: Recidivism Prevention
items.text: Reducing criminals' likelihood of reoffending through psychological assessment and intervention.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Research
items.text: Deepening understanding of criminal psychology through scientific research to promote disciplinary development.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Education
items.text: Cultivating professionals through education to improve the application level of criminal psychology.

items.title: Professional Training
items.text: Improving judicial personnel's psychological knowledge and skills through training.

items.title: Academic Exchange
items.text: Promoting international cooperation and development in criminal psychology through academic exchange.

data.title: Future Development Trends
data.text: This chapter will explore future development directions of criminal psychology in technology applications, interdisciplinary cooperation and ethical challenges.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence and Criminal Psychology
items.text: Using AI technology to analyze crime data and improve crime prediction capabilities.

items.title: Big Data Analysis
items.text: Mining patterns and psychological characteristics of criminal behavior through big data technology.

items.title: Virtual Reality Technology
items.text: Using VR technology to simulate crime scenes and study criminals' psychological responses.

items.title: Neuroscience Research
items.text: Exploring the biological basis of criminal behavior through neuroscience research.

items.title: Psychology and Law
items.text: Strengthening cooperation between psychology and law to improve the scientific nature of the judicial system.

items.title: Psychology and Medicine
items.text: Deepening understanding of criminal psychology through the integration of psychology and medicine.

items.title: Psychology and Sociology
items.text: Comprehensively analyzing criminal phenomena through interdisciplinary research between psychology and sociology.

items.title: Psychology and Information Technology
items.text: Developing new tools for crime prevention and intervention by combining psychology and information technology.

items.title: Ethical Issues
items.text: Exploring ethical dilemmas and solutions in criminal psychology research.

items.title: Privacy Protection
items.text: Researching how to protect personal privacy in criminal psychology applications.

items.title: Data Security
items.text: Analyzing security risks and protective measures for criminal psychology data.

items.title: Future Challenges
items.text: Exploring potential technological and social challenges in the future development of criminal psychology.
